title: Daily Temperatures
description: Given an array of integers temperatures represents the daily temperatures, return an array answer such that answer[i] is the number of days you have to wait after the ith day to get a warmer temperature. If there is no future day for which this is possible, keep answer[i] == 0.

brute-force.name: Nested Loops
brute-force.description: For each day, check future days.

steps.instruction: Define the function daily_temperatures that takes temperatures.

steps.hint: Use nested loops. Inner loop finds first day with higher temp.

optimal.name: Monotonic Stack
optimal.description: Use a stack to store indices of decreasing temperatures.

steps.instruction: Define the function daily_temperatures that takes temperatures.

steps.hint: Initialize `res` with zeros and an empty `stack`.

Iterate. While current temp > stack top temp, pop and calculate days difference.

Example:
Temps=[73, 74]. Stack=[(73, 0)].
i=1, t=74. 74 > 73. Pop (73, 0).
res[0] = 1 - 0 = 1. Push (74, 1).
